field_edited_text.value:
D. PRIGE

The price of Area 12 is One Million Two Hundred Fifty Thousand
Dollars ($1,250,000.00), subject to the provisions of the Proposed Form
of Disposition Agreement. (For a summary of the major provisions, see
pages 9-15 herein.)

E. DEMOLITION AND SITE PREPARATION



The City has prepared the Site for delivery. Demolition has in-
cluded removing all parts of buildings and structures to approximate grade
of adjacent existing streets and alleys. Basement floors have been broken
to provide drainage and basements have been backfilled and utility lines
abandoned or relocated.

F. SITE DELIVERY AND DEVELOPMENT



Development Area 12 will be available for delivery on or after
January 1, 1966, and the Site will be turned over to the Developer in the
condition described in paragraph Eabove. Prior to that time, the selected
developer may make arrangements for entry on the site for engineering
surveys, test borings and other investigations desired by his representa-
tives.

| Upon delivery, the site will be ready for development in accordance
with the Charles Center Urban Renewal Plan and the terms of the dispo-
sition agreement between the City and the Developer.

G. ZONING

The Site, like all of Charles Center, is zoned First Commerical
Use District.

H. TOPOGRAPHY AND UTILITIES



The City's Bureau of Surveys has completed a detailed fieldsurvey
of existing conditions in and around the entire Charles Center Site. No
major change in the grades of:Lombard, Charles and Baltimore Streets or
Hopkins Place is planned. For spot elevations of adjacent streets and de-
velopment, see Exhibit entitled, Site Definition, page 10.



Utilities are available in adjacent streets subject to the usual ar-
rangements with the City and with the various private utility companies.
Details may be obtained from the responsible City Bureau and/or private
utility company.

R
s
